title: The Register - Software
subtitle: Biting the hand that feeds IT — sci/tech news and views for the world

entryCollection.title: Today's budget for application improvements is brought to you by the letters "Y", "K" and the number "2"
entryCollection.summary:
Slipping in the enhancements while everyone else is watching the calendar

Y2K  Welcome to Y2K, a series of tales from Register readers who found themselves at the sharp, pointy end of the turn of the century IT panic of two decades ago.…

entryCollection.title: Remembering Y2K call-outs and the joy of the hourly contractor rate
entryCollection.summary:
We'll pay anything, anything - just don't turn that phone off

Y2K  There's a reason why some in IT remember the days of Y2K fondly. To quote a lyric from an erstwhile pop combo of the 80s, it really could be "Money for Nothing" for a lucky few. Welcome to The Register's reader recollections of the era.…
